Dear Group,

I would like to simulate a zero-d, variable-T,P reactor. I hav=
e
profiles of T(time) and P(time) from a separate fluid-dynamic
calculation=
 of flow in a probe and sample line. I'm assuming plug flow
and so using th=
e zero-d eqns with time in the batch system really
representing residence t=
ime along the PFR (i.e. sample line). (I'm
trying to predict measurement er=
rors due to chemical conversion in
sample systems used to measure trace gas=
es from jet aircraft engines.)
I have a table of values for time, T and P t=
hat I would like to
interpolate to get the current reactor conditions.

Doe=
s anyone have a Python script to model a variable-T,P reactor or
some gener=
al guidance about how to approach the problem? Thanks very
much for your he=
lp.

I'm using the Python interface to Cantera v1.6.

Best,

Paul
